required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Comparing the Safety and Efficacy of Tigecycline With Ampicillin-Sulbactam or Amoxicillin-Clavulanate to Treat Skin Infections
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Open-Label Comparison of the Safety And Efficacy of Tigecycline With That of Ampicillin-Sulbactam or Amoxicillin-Clavulanate to Treat Complicated Skin And Skin Structure Infections

lead_sponsor.agency: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

clinical_study.source: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the safety and efficacy of the antibiotic tigecycline with other antibiotics, ampicillin-sulbactam, and amoxicillin-clavulanate in the treatment of a complicated skin and/or skin structure infection (cSSSI).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Clinically Evaluable (CE) Patients With Clinical Response of Cure at the Test-of-cure (TOC) Visit
primary_outcome.description: Investigator assigned clinical response of cure of the cSSSI defined as: resolution of all clinical signs and symptoms of infection (healing of chronic underlying skin ulcer not required) or improvement of signs or symptoms of the infection to such an extent that no further antibacterial therapy was necessary. CE population were those who completed TOC assessment of cure or failure (but not indeterminate) or, in case of premature discontinuation due to lack of efficacy, had completed end of treatment assessment such that assessment of clinical response could be made.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Microbiologically Evaluable Patients With Clinical Response of Cure at the Test-of-cure (TOC) Visit
secondary_outcome.description: Investigator assigned clinical response of cure of the cSSSI defined as: resolution of all clinical signs and symptoms of infection (healing of chronic underlying skin ulcer not required) or improvement of signs or symptoms of the infection to such an extent that no further antibacterial therapy was necessary. ME population were subjects who were CE and had baseline culture with at least 1 identified isolate that was susceptible to study drug and comparator. TOC performed 8-50 days after last dose of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Microbiologically Evaluable Patients by Microbiologic Response at Test-of-Cure (TOC) Visit
secondary_outcome.description: Microbiological response assessed at patient level. Eradication=baseline isolate not present in repeat culture from the original infection site; Presumed Eradication=clinical response of cure precluded the availability of a specimen for culture; Persistence=baseline isolate present in repeat culture from the original infection site; Presumed Persistence=culture data not available for patients with a clinical response of failure; Superinfection=culture from the primary infection site had new pathogen not identified as a baseline isolate and clinical response was failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Minimum Inhibitory Concentration (MIC) 50 and 90 by Baseline Isolate
secondary_outcome.description: In vitro activity of the study drugs against a range of pathogenic bacteria that cause complicated skin and skin structure infection (cSSSI) were analyzed using MIC. MIC 50 and MIC 90 are the lowest concentrations of a drug that inhibit the growth of 50% and 90% of a microorganism, respectively. TOC performed 8-50 days after last dose of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Inpatient Healthcare Resource Utilization on or Before Test-of-Cure - Number of Patients
secondary_outcome.description: Healthcare resource utilization assessment included intensive care unit (ICU) and non-ICU inpatient hospitalization. TOC performed 8-50 days after last dose of study drug.

arm_group.description: Arm 2: Ampicillin-Sulbactam or Amoxicillin-Clavulanate plus or minus a glycopeptide

intervention.description: Treatment A: Tigecycline every 12 hours intravenous (IV) (an initial dose of 100 mg followed by 50 mg every 12 hours)

Ampicillin-sulbactam: 1.5 g (1 g ampicillin plus 0.5 g sulbactam) to 3 g (3 g ampicillin plus 1 g sulbactam) intravenous (IV) every 6 hrs or Amoxicillin-clavulanate: 1.2 g (1000 mg amoxicillin plus 200 mg clavulanate) IV every 6 to 8 hrs. A glycopeptide antibiotic (either vancomycin 1 g IV every 12 hrs or teicoplanin IV loading dose of 400 mg the first day followed by a maintenance dose of 200 mg daily) may be added to the aminopenicillin/betalactamase inhibitor regimen if infection with methicillin-resistant staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) is suspected or confirmed within the first 72 hrs of enrollment. If culture results fail to show a resistant organism, use of the glycopeptide may be discontinued.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of complicated skin or skin structure infection
- Male or female, 18 years or older
- Need for intravenous treatment for 4 to 14 days
Exclusion Criteria:
- Skin infection that can be treated by surgery & wound care alone
- Diabetic foot ulcers or bedsores where the infection is present longer than 1 week
- Poor circulation such that amputation of the infected site is likely within a month Other exclusions apply

overall_official.affiliation: Wyeth is now a wholly owned subsidiary of Pfizer

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients were recruited worldwide from September 2006 to August 2008.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Patients were screened according to the inclusion/exclusion criteria. Once informed consent was obtained, the patient was enrolled into the study and assigned a randomization number and a treatment regimen.

group.title: Tigecycline
group.description: Tigecycline every 12 hours IV (an initial dose of 100 mg followed by 50 mg every 12 hours)

group.title: Ampicillin-Sulbactam or Amoxicillin-Clavulanate
group.description: Ampicillin-sulbactam 1.5 g (1 g ampicillin plus 0.5 g sulbactam) to 3 g (2 g ampicillin plus 1 g sulbactam) IV every 6 hours or amoxicillin-clavulanate 1.2 g (1000 mg amoxicillin plus 200 mg clavulanate) IV every 6 to 8 hours.

group.title: Tigecycline
group.description: Tigecycline every 12 hours IV (an initial dose of 100 mg followed by 50 mg every 12 hours)

group.title: Ampicillin-Sulbactam or Amoxicillin-Clavulanate
group.description: Ampicillin-sulbactam 1.5 g (1 g ampicillin plus 0.5 g sulbactam) to 3 g (2 g ampicillin plus 1 g sulbactam) IV every 6 hours or amoxicillin-clavulanate 1.2 g (1000 mg amoxicillin plus 200 mg clavulanate) IV every 6 to 8 hours.

outcome.title: Number of Clinically Evaluable (CE) Patients With Clinical Response of Cure at the Test-of-cure (TOC) Visit
outcome.description: Investigator assigned clinical response of cure of the cSSSI defined as: resolution of all clinical signs and symptoms of infection (healing of chronic underlying skin ulcer not required) or improvement of signs or symptoms of the infection to such an extent that no further antibacterial therapy was necessary. CE population were those who completed TOC assessment of cure or failure (but not indeterminate) or, in case of premature discontinuation due to lack of efficacy, had completed end of treatment assessment such that assessment of clinical response could be made.
outcome.population: Clinically Evaluable (CE): Patients with cSSSI, no Pseudomonas aeruginosa as sole baseline isolate, met major inclusion/exclusion criteria, ≤24 hrs antibiotics pre-baseline, had ≥4 days of study drug, compliant with therapy. Excludes indeterminates.

group.title: Tigecycline
group.description: Tigecycline every 12 hours IV (an initial dose of 100 mg followed by 50 mg every 12 hours)

group.title: Ampicillin-Sulbactam or Amoxicillin-Clavulanate
group.description: Ampicillin-sulbactam 1.5 g (1 g ampicillin plus 0.5 g sulbactam) to 3 g (2 g ampicillin plus 1 g sulbactam) IV every 6 hours or amoxicillin-clavulanate 1.2 g (1000 mg amoxicillin plus 200 mg clavulanate) IV every 6 to 8 hours.

measure.title: Number of Clinically Evaluable (CE) Patients With Clinical Response of Cure at the Test-of-cure (TOC) Visit
measure.description: Investigator assigned clinical response of cure of the cSSSI defined as: resolution of all clinical signs and symptoms of infection (healing of chronic underlying skin ulcer not required) or improvement of signs or symptoms of the infection to such an extent that no further antibacterial therapy was necessary. CE population were those who completed TOC assessment of cure or failure (but not indeterminate) or, in case of premature discontinuation due to lack of efficacy, had completed end of treatment assessment such that assessment of clinical response could be made.
measure.population: Clinically Evaluable (CE): Patients with cSSSI, no Pseudomonas aeruginosa as sole baseline isolate, met major inclusion/exclusion criteria, ≤24 hrs antibiotics pre-baseline, had ≥4 days of study drug, compliant with therapy. Excludes indeterminates.

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: A 2-sided 95% CI (corrected for continuity) was calculated for the true difference between the cure rates. Non-inferiority will be concluded if the lower limit of the 2-sided CI is greater than -15%.
analysis.estimate_desc: Confidence interval calculated using asymptotic method corrected for continuity. Difference= Tigecycline minus Ampicillin-Sulbactam or Amoxicillin-Clavulanate.

outcome.title: Number of Microbiologically Evaluable Patients With Clinical Response of Cure at the Test-of-cure (TOC) Visit
outcome.description: Investigator assigned clinical response of cure of the cSSSI defined as: resolution of all clinical signs and symptoms of infection (healing of chronic underlying skin ulcer not required) or improvement of signs or symptoms of the infection to such an extent that no further antibacterial therapy was necessary. ME population were subjects who were CE and had baseline culture with at least 1 identified isolate that was susceptible to study drug and comparator. TOC performed 8-50 days after last dose of study drug.
outcome.population: Microbiologically Evaluable patients:Clinically Evaluable (CE) patients who had baseline culture with ≥1 identified pathogen susceptible to both study drugs (ie, the pathogen is susceptible to tigecycline and comparator). Excludes indeterminates.

group.title: Tigecycline
group.description: Tigecycline every 12 hours IV (an initial dose of 100 mg followed by 50 mg every 12 hours)

group.title: Ampicillin-Sulbactam or Amoxicillin-Clavulanate
group.description: Ampicillin-sulbactam 1.5 g (1 g ampicillin plus 0.5 g sulbactam) to 3 g (2 g ampicillin plus 1 g sulbactam) IV every 6 hours or amoxicillin-clavulanate 1.2 g (1000 mg amoxicillin plus 200 mg clavulanate) IV every 6 to 8 hours.

ME population were subjects who were CE and had baseline culture with at least 1 identified isolate that was susceptible to study drug and comparator. TOC performed 8-50 days after last dose of study drug.

analysis.estimate_desc: Confidence interval calculated using asymptotic method corrected for continuity. Difference= Tigecycline minus Ampicillin-Sulbactam or Amoxicillin-Clavulanate.

outcome.description: Microbiological response assessed at patient level. Eradication=baseline isolate not present in repeat culture from the original infection site; Presumed Eradication=clinical response of cure precluded the availability of a specimen for culture; Persistence=baseline isolate present in repeat culture from the original infection site; Presumed Persistence=culture data not available for patients with a clinical response of failure; Superinfection=culture from the primary infection site had new pathogen not identified as a baseline isolate and clinical response was failure.
outcome.population: Microbiologically Evaluable patients:CE patients who had baseline culture with ≥1 identified pathogen susceptible to both study drugs (ie, the pathogen is susceptible to tigecycline and comparator). TOC performed 8-50 days after last dose of study drug.

group.title: Ampicillin-Sulbactam or Amoxicillin-Clavulanate
group.description: Ampicillin-sulbactam 1.5 g (1 g ampicillin plus 0.5 g sulbactam) to 3 g (2 g ampicillin plus 1 g sulbactam) IV every 6 hours or amoxicillin-clavulanate 1.2 g (1000 mg amoxicillin plus 200 mg clavulanate) IV every 6 to 8 hours.

measure.population: Microbiologically Evaluable patients:CE patients who had baseline culture with ≥1 identified pathogen susceptible to both study drugs (ie, the pathogen is susceptible to tigecycline and comparator). TOC performed 8-50 days after last dose of study drug.

analysis.groups_desc: Group comparison of eradication + presumed eradication
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: A 2-sided 95% CI (corrected for continuity) was calculated for the true difference between the cure rates. Non-inferiority will be concluded if the lower limit of the 2-sided CI is greater than -15%.
analysis.estimate_desc: Confidence interval calculated using asymptotic method corrected for continuity. Difference= Tigecycline minus Ampicillin-Sulbactam or Amoxicillin-Clavulanate.

outcome.title: Minimum Inhibitory Concentration (MIC) 50 and 90 by Baseline Isolate
outcome.description: In vitro activity of the study drugs against a range of pathogenic bacteria that cause complicated skin and skin structure infection (cSSSI) were analyzed using MIC. MIC 50 and MIC 90 are the lowest concentrations of a drug that inhibit the growth of 50% and 90% of a microorganism, respectively. TOC performed 8-50 days after last dose of study drug.
outcome.population: m-mITT: Patients with ≥1 dose of study drug, had cSSSI and baseline isolate from infection site / blood. MIC reported for isolates present in ≥10 m-mITT patients. In the categories below "n" is the actual number of isolates used to caluculate the MIC 50 and MIC 90.

group.title: Tigecycline
group.description: Tigecycline every 12 hours IV (an initial dose of 100 mg followed by 50 mg every 12 hours)

group.title: Ampicillin-Sulbactam or Amoxicillin-Clavulanate

measure.population: m-mITT: Patients with ≥1 dose of study drug, had cSSSI and baseline isolate from infection site / blood. MIC reported for isolates present in ≥10 m-mITT patients. In the categories below "n" is the actual number of isolates used to caluculate the MIC 50 and MIC 90.

outcome.title: Inpatient Healthcare Resource Utilization on or Before Test-of-Cure - Number of Patients
outcome.description: Healthcare resource utilization assessment included intensive care unit (ICU) and non-ICU inpatient hospitalization. TOC performed 8-50 days after last dose of study drug.
outcome.population: All patients who received at least 1 dose of study article.

measure.description: Healthcare resource utilization assessment included intensive care unit (ICU) and non-ICU inpatient hospitalization. TOC performed 8-50 days after last dose of study drug.
measure.population: All patients who received at least 1 dose of study article.

reported_events.desc: This data represents the number of times a given adverse event was reported. The given participant may have experienced more than one adverse event. We are looking at the frequency of adverse events based on event and not by participant.

group.title: Tigecycline
group.description: Tigecycline every 12 hours IV (an initial dose of 100 mg followed by 50 mg every 12 hours)

group.title: Ampicillin-Sulbactam or Amoxicillin-Clavulanate
group.description: Ampicillin-sulbactam 1.5 g (1 g ampicillin plus 0.5 g sulbactam) to 3 g (2 g ampicillin plus 1 g sulbactam) IV every 6 hours or amoxicillin-clavulanate 1.2 g (1000 mg amoxicillin plus 200 mg clavulanate) IV every 6 to 8 hours.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The PIs agreed to allow the sponsor 60 days to review and require changes to presentations or publications but only to protect confidential information and intellectual property, and for the sponsor to file a patent application, as applicable. The PIs also agreed for data to be presented first as a joint, multi-center publication.
